sections.summary: The 'Ultimate Leading Indicator' of global industrial health. The BDI measures the cost of transporting raw materials (iron ore, coal, grains) across 20+ key shipping routes.
sections.deep_dive: Unlike other indices, the BDI is 'Pure Supply and Demand'. It has no 'Futures' market, meaning it cannot be manipulated by speculators. It tracks the real movement of physical stuff. In 2026, the BDI has become a barometer of 'Global Friction'. As the world shifts from 'Just-in-Time' to 'Just-in-Case' inventories, the volume of raw materials being hoarded is spiking. When the BDI rises, it signals a scramble for commoditiesâ€”often led by Chinese infrastructure booms or global manufacturing re-armament. Conversely, a crashing BDI is the first signal of a global recession, often appearing 3-6 months before PMIs or stock market drops. It is comprised of three sub-indices: Capesize (the giants moving iron ore), Panamax, and Supramax. In 2026, climate-related chokepoints in the Panama Canal and geopolitical risks in the Suez have made the BDI more volatile than any other macro indicator.

council_debate.geopolitics: The 'Chokepoint Barometer'. The BDI reflects the 'Inefficiency Premium' of a fractured world where ships must take longer routes around Africa.
council_debate.macro: Leading indicator for the Global ISM Manufacturing BMI. If BDI is rising while PMIs are flat, it means commodities are being hoarded.
council_debate.quant: There is a +0.76 correlation between BDI spikes and inflationary pressure in the Eurozone with a 4-month lag.
council_debate.technical: The 1,500 level is the historical 'Boom/Bust' pivot point. Staying above 2,500 suggests a full-blown commodity super-cycle is in play.
council_debate.policy: IMO 2023/2026 carbon regulations are forcing older ships to 'Slow-Steam' (move slower to save fuel), effectively reducing global supply and boosting rates.
council_debate.tech: AI-driven route optimization and the rise of autonomous 'Green Ships' are starting to decouple BDI from traditional bunker fuel costs.

sections.forecast_risks: The 'China Demand Collapse' risk: If the Chinese property bubble finally implodes totally, the BDI (Capesize) would fall 90% as iron ore demand evaporates.
sections.gms_conclusion: The truest, un-manipulated signal of physical commerce on Earth.
